title: Riot, Akali mains are speaking, You said you would cater to us, Then listen to us.
body: I have been playing Akali for the last 9 months and me and every other Akali main has said that we don't like these changes. The community is clearly dissatisfied with these changes and we haven't hear anything pertaining to fixing them yet. This is a problem because we are so close to the pre season and we don't know what you're doing to our favorite champion. From what i've read, you wanted the akali changes to be tailored towards mains, and almost all the mains are speaking against the changes. Please listen to the community.

Everything said in the video feels either overblown or has been changed prior to this post.

Passive: Changed to 2-hit burst damage/heal combo instead of some weird DPS/heal thing that allowed Akali to chain kills easy. Also has been heavily modified since video (now AD/AP ratios on both attacks, and generally more generous).

W: Duration set back to 8 seconds at all levels. Also, not following what is wrong with this new teleport mechanic. Would like to see in action. Will admit, sounds pointless, but it is a free flash with a slow to cover your ground.

E: It's a damage buff, pretty much through and through. Not as bursty with higher cooldowns at high levels, but top laners were abusing this (See her Champion.gg ). On the other side of things, it wastes less energy for the power, so that's something.

R: Nerfed badly. That said, the ability is a double flash range on top of an enemy already, and at an absurdly low cooldown for the combo damage alone.

I will say, I do have reservations about this build, but you're missing the picture entirely. She has a mini Flash pre-6 now, with the old movement jolt on top of it, and a speedy escape route, too. This can be used to actually harass in the mid lane, instead of basically sitting under tower until level 6. And even if you are stuck under there, Crescent Slash has only been buffed for waveclear purposes. 

In top, she can't spam Crescent Slash to burst enemies down along with the whole wave, but instead she has a real harass now. Toss a Q, run up and auto double proc > Q > auto double proc, and toss in a bulkier Crescent Slash on top, you won't be losing many trades up there, either, and all within 2 autos and several fast casting spells. And I don't even think her trades were particularly bad up there, either, they just required basically fighting in your shroud, and out-DPSing your enemies with E and passive, on an assassin champ... I'm kinda glad she lost her DPS for some burst, actually. She will still be quite imposing, but I'm hopeful that she won't assassinate so fast, and that an enemy can turn around and knock her back down heavily, and probably waste her escape tool in the process.

All in all, I see her getting a lot more potential early game, and that scares me that she will be overpowered early on, and then will eventaually fall off when her 2 second R cooldown actually means something lategame. I don't want them to strive for that pattern, but I think it actually plays toward the Akali player playstyle of midgame menace, with some bonus early game pressure added in.
